articles.name: Nevada airport information for drivers
articles.title: Nevada airport information for drivers
articles.body:
To ensure a smooth airport experience for you and your passengers, make sure to familiarize yourself with the rules below. Tap each link to jump to detailed instructions on each section:

  • Rules for all airports
  • Permitted Airports

The following information applies to all airports:

Airport officials will issue administrative citations to drivers who do not follow the rules. You are responsible for paying any tickets you receive for violating airport rules and regulations.

Lyft emblem
  • Keep your Lyft emblem displayed in your lower right hand (passenger side) of your front windshield at all times while giving Lyft rides.
  • If you are giving a non-Lyft ride at the airport, make sure to remove your emblem before entering airport property.
  • If you’ve just been approved to drive, you should receive your Lyft emblem shortly. If you didn't get one or need a new one, place an order in your Dashboard. While waiting for it to arrive, you may print a temporary emblem.

Conduct at the airport
  • Do not stop or pull over in crosswalks.
  • Do not park in red zones or taxi/shuttle areas unless otherwise specified in the rules above.
  • Always follow instructions given by airport personnel.
  • If you run into any trouble, like a regulatory citation, reach out to our Support team. We're here to help 24/7.
Waybill
  • Airport authorities may ask you for a waybill, which shows your latest ride. Click here to learn how to access your waybill.

Back to top

Permitted Airports

Drivers on the Lyft platform are responsible for knowing and following all airport regulations in order to avoid receiving administrative citations from the airport. Lyft is available at the following airports in Nevada:

  • Henderson Executive Airport | HSH
  • Las Vegas McCarran International Airport | LAS
    • McCarran Rent-A-Car Center | LAS
  • Reno-Tahoe International Airport | RNO
Las Vegas McCarran International Airport (LAS)

Beginning in mid-September 2018, Lyft will be testing airport queues separated by ride type at LAS airport. With separated queues, drivers will now have more visibility into what position they are for each mode they are driving for.

Driver Manual:

  • Please read and review the McCarran Airport driver manual before your first ride, and any time you have questions.

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area. Only drivers within the designated staging area (open in Google Maps) are added to the queue.
  • Follow all airport rules. Have your app open in driver mode, display your Lyft emblem, park correctly in the stall, follow all traffic control signs, remain with your vehicle unless taking a short restroom break, and do not litter.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.
  • If the staging area is full, you must leave the airport. You may not wait for requests anywhere else on airport property or use any other parking lots while in driver mode.
  • Passenger cancellations don't affect your place in line. If your passenger cancels on you, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue.
  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.
  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups:

  • Terminal 1: Pick up passengers on the Valet Level of the parking garage (pictured above).
  • Terminal 3: Pick up passengers on the Valet Level of the parking garage (pictured above).
  • Please call and instruct your passengers to follow the Rideshare signs from the main terminal to the designated parking garage (level & section) where you will meet.
  • When using the designated T-1 and T-3 loading areas, please use the designated loading stalls — DO NOT load in the Thru Lane.
  • If the loading area is congested and/or you have been waiting too long, DOA staff will instruct you to exit and circle around to reenter the Loading area. You must follow any instructions and directions from all DOA staff working in the curb areas, loading areas, and staging area.
  • Do not pick up passengers from Arrivals at the main terminal entrance.
  • Do not wait on the terminal roadway if your passenger is delayed. Head to the staging lot and wait there. If the staging lot is full, you will need to leave airport property.
  • Pre-dispatch: While waiting for requests, you may receive an SMS and/or in-app note directing you to head toward the terminal. While en route, you should receive a ride request. If you do not, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue. More information on pre-dispatch can be found here.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers at the Departure Curbs area at the passenger's carrier of choice. Leave the terminal immediately after dropping off.
  • As soon as you've dropped off your passenger, press 'Tap to drop off' in your app and exit airport property. Wait to rate your passenger until you've left the airport.
  • It's important to note: the Lyft app will not allow you to receive requests in any area on airport property other than the staging lot .

Prohibited Activities:

  • Drivers will not solicit customers in any form by vocally calling out or using any other means of attracting customers, nor solicit on behalf of any motel, hotel, day or night club, etc.
  • Drivers will not utilize any other person or agent, including but not limited to Airport skycaps, baggage check persons or any other employees to solicit customers in any manner whatsoever.
  • Drivers will not operate on Airport property without an activated TNC Application, approved Trade Dress, NTA Vehicle Inspection Decal, and a laminated valid Clark County Business License (per Clark County Ordinance Section 6.12.447) affixed to the lower tight side of the front windshield.
  • Drivers will not display Trade Dress when not on-duty. If Trade Dress is displayed while on Airport property, the driver is presumed to be on-duty as a TNC Driver and must follow all the Airport’s rules.
  • If a TNC Driver’s Trade Dress is displayed and that driver uses either Passenger Pickup curbs or public parking facility, including Employee parking areas, the driver will be issued a Notice of Parking Infraction.
  • Drivers will not pick up or drop off passengers or their luggage at any Airport location other than Designated Areas. Drivers must not load in any thru lane in Designated Areas.
  • Drivers will not leave vehicle unattended while the engine is running, or with keys in the ignition. Drivers must remain with their vehicles at all times while the engine is running, even when passengers are in the vehicle.
  • Drivers will not use profane, vulgar language or participate in offensive conduct directed at the public and/or any Airport personnel.
  • Drivers will not feed birds or other animals on Airport property.
  • Any form of littering is strictly prohibited.
  • Damaging or defacing any Airport property, or failing to properly report such damage to the appropriate Airport staff, is prohibited.
  • Failing to give, upon passenger’s or Airport personnel’s request, the driver’s correct name, the name of TNC, or the driver’s TNC identification number or vehicle number, if any, is prohibited.
  • Failing to immediately comply with requests from Airport personnel or local law enforcement, to provide proof of insurance, license and registration, Waybill, or confirmation that the TNC App is activated while on Airport property or within the Airport Geo-Fence Tracking Areas is prohibited.
  • Transporting a passenger in an unauthorized TNC Vehicle is prohibited.
  • Using or possessing any alcoholic beverages, dangerous drugs or narcotic while on Airport property is prohibited.
  • Any attempt to bypass TNC App and solicit cash payment from passengers is prohibited.
  • Any violation of any Airport Rules and Regulations or Operating Directives is prohibited.
  • Any violation of any term or obligation in the TNC Operating Permit is prohibited.
  • Refusing to follow directions given by Airport personnel is prohibited.
  • Umbrellas, tables, chairs, coolers, games, or other similar related items are not permitted in the Staging Area.
  • TNC and/or TNC Drivers are prohibited from wrapping or using any other material on the exterior of a TNC Vehicle to advertise or promote third party goods or services for pay or other consideration.

Back to airport list
Back to top

McCarran Rent-A-Car Center

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers in the public access lane.

Drop-offs:

  • Enter from the north side of Gilespie St and drop off passengers in the middle lane.

Back to airport list
Back to top

Reno-Tahoe International Airport (RNO)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area pictured above. Only drivers within the designated staging area (located off Air Cargo Way) are added to the queue.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.
  • If the staging area is full, you must leave the airport. You may not wait for requests anywhere else on airport property or use any other parking lots while in driver mode.

Pickups:

Please note that if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line
  • Please note: if you are a driver whose home region is New Jersey, you are not able to receive ride requests in New York City. If a passenger ride has brought you into New York City, you will need to return to New Jersey in order to receive another ride request.

  • LaGuardia Airport | LGA
John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area. Only drivers within the staging area are added to the queue. Use either the Cell Phone Lot or the Limousine Lot.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.
  • If the staging area is full, you must leave the airport. You may not wait for requests anywhere else on airport property or use any other parking lots while in driver mode.
  • Passenger cancellations don't affect your place in line. If your passenger cancels on you, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue.
  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.
  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers from Arrivals, at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You’ll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers curbside at the terminal entrance, at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal after drop-off. If you'd like to wait for additional requests, proceed to the staging area.

Back to top

LaGuardia Airport (LGA)

For real-time updates on last flights in, as well as operational changes, please visit LaGuardia airport's FHV Twitter account.

Waiting for requests:

  • Beginning 4/18/2020 Terminal B, C & D queues will consolidate into the same surface lot between 90th and 92nd St along 23rd Ave as pictured above. While you are waiting in this lot, you can receive a ride at Terminals B, C or D. Please be aware of which terminal your passenger is requesting a ride from.
  • Wait in the designated staging area(s). Only drivers within the staging area(s) are added to the queue.
    • Terminal A: There is no queue for Terminal A. Drivers are permitted to use the southern portion of the P10 lot to wait for Terminal A ride requests, but rides will be dispatched by proximity/ETA only.
    • Terminal B: Beginning 4/18/2020 Lyft staging for all vehicles (including Lux) will move to the surface lot between 90th and 92nd St along 23rd Ave as pictured above (same as the Terminal C&D staging area).
    • Terminals C & D: The FHV waiting lot for Terminals C & D will be located in the surface lot between 90th and 92nd St along 23rd Ave as pictured above (same as the Terminal B staging area).
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.
  • If the staging area is full, you must leave the airport. You may not wait for requests anywhere else on airport property or use any other parking lots while in driver mode.
  • Passenger cancellations don't affect your place in line. If your passenger cancels on you, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue.
  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.
  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups:

  • Terminal A: Pick up passengers from Arrivals, at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Terminal B: Pick up passengers from Level 2 of the Terminal B Garage between columns F and G.
    • You may receive ride requests that require you to enter a rider’s 4-digit pickup code before starting the ride. This feature is called Fast Match, and is designed to provide smoother pickups and reduce airport congestion.
      • Fast Match pickups will occur on Level 2 of the garage in by the G Columns.
      • Normal pickups for all other modes will occur by the F Columns.
      • Learn more about Fast Match here.
  • Terminals C & D: Pick up in the Car Services Area located between Terminals C & D (Lanes L & M; stalls 1-3). Use the lower level (Delta Arrivals Rd) to access this area.
    • You may receive ride requests that require you to enter a rider’s 4-digit pickup code before starting the ride. This feature is called Fast Match, and is designed to provide smoother pickups and reduce airport congestion.
      • Fast Match pickups will occur on either side of Island M in the Car Services Area between Terminals C & D.
      • Normal pickups for all other modes will occur in Lane L.
      • Learn more about Fast Match here.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up.
  • Pre-dispatch: While waiting for ride requests at Terminals C & D, you may receive an SMS and an in-app note directing you to head toward the terminal. While en route, you should receive a ride request. If you do not, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue. More information on pre-dispatch can be found here.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You’ll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.
  • Fast Match pickup codes: You may receive ride requests that require you to enter a rider’s 4-digit code before starting the ride. See more about using Fast Match.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers curbside at the terminal entrance, at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal after drop-off. If you'd like to wait for additional requests, proceed to the staging area.

Back to top

  • Pre-dispatch: While waiting for requests, you may receive an SMS and an in-app note directing you to head toward the terminal. While en route, you should receive a ride request. If you do not, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue. More information on pre-dispatch can be found here.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up. Instead, head to the staging lot and wait there.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers at Departures, at the passenger's carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal after drop-off. If you'd like to wait for additional requests, proceed to the staging area.

  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers from the designated zone by parking lot 2, by the museum. It is marked with Lyft signs.
    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to an approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location and are on the correct level of the airport.

articles.name: North Carolina airport information for drivers
articles.title: North Carolina airport information for drivers
articles.body:
To ensure a smooth airport experience for you and your passengers, make sure to familiarize yourself with the rules below. Tap each link to jump to detailed instructions on each section:

  • Rules for all airports
  • Permitted Airports

The following information applies to all airports:

Airport officials will issue administrative citations to drivers who do not follow the rules. You are responsible for paying any tickets you receive for violating airport rules and regulations.

Lyft emblem
  • Keep your Lyft emblem displayed in your lower right hand (passenger side) of your front windshield at all times while giving Lyft rides.
  • If you are giving a non-Lyft ride at the airport, make sure to remove your emblem before entering airport property.
  • If you’ve just been approved to drive, you should receive your Lyft emblem shortly. If you didn't get one or need a new one, place an order in your Dashboard. While waiting for it to arrive, you may print a temporary emblem.

Conduct at the airport
  • Do not stop or pull over in crosswalks.
  • Do not park in red zones or taxi/shuttle areas unless otherwise specified in the rules above.
  • Always follow instructions given by airport personnel.
  • If you run into any trouble, like a regulatory citation, reach out to our Support team. We're here to help 24/7.
Waybill
  • Airport authorities may ask you for a waybill, which shows your latest ride. Click here to learn how to access your waybill.

Back to top

Permitted Airports

Drivers on the Lyft platform are responsible for knowing and following all airport regulations in order to avoid receiving administrative citations from the airport. Lyft is available at the following airports in North Carolina:

  • Asheville Regional Airport | AVL
  • Charlotte Douglas International Airport | CLT
  • Fayetteville Regional Airport | FAY
  • Greensboro Piedmont Triad International Airport | GSO
  • Jacksonville Albert J. Ellis Airport | OAJ
  • New Bern Coastal Carolina Regional Airport | EWN
  • Raleigh-Durham International Airport | RDU
  • Rowan County Airport | SRW
  • Wilmington International Airport | ILM
Asheville Regional Airport (AVL)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area. Only drivers within the designated staging area (pictured above) are added to the queue.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.
  • If the staging area is full, you must leave the airport. You may not wait for requests anywhere else on airport property or use any other parking lots while in driver mode.
  • Passenger cancellations don't affect your place in line. If your passenger cancels on you, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue.
  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.
  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers on the north side of the terminal as pictured above.
    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to an approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location and are on the correct level of the airport.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up. Instead, head to the staging lot and wait there.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers at Departures at the passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport after drop-off. You must leave airport property immediately after dropping off your passenger.

Back to airport list
Back to top

Charlotte Douglas International Airport (CLT)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area. Only drivers within the designated staging area (pictured above) are added to the queue. Do not wait for requests on Stafford Ave.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.

  • Passenger cancellations don't affect your place in line. If your passenger cancels on you, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue.
  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.
  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers from Arrivals on the lower level, at Zone D.
    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to an approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location and are on the correct level of the airport.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up. Instead, head to the staging lot and wait there.
  • Pre-dispatch: While waiting for requests, you may receive an SMS and an in-app note directing you to head toward the terminal. While en route, you should receive a ride request. If you do not, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue. More information on pre-dispatch can be found here.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers at Departures, at the passenger's carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal after drop-off. If you'd like to wait for additional requests, proceed to the staging area.

Back to airport list
Back to top

Greensboro Piedmont Triad International Airport (GSO)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in one of the designated 24 TNC parking spaces in the staging area. Only drivers within the designated staging area (pictured above) are added to the queue. Do not wait for requests in the metered parking spots.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.
  • If the staging area is full, you must leave the airport. You may not wait for requests anywhere else on airport property or use any other parking lots while in driver mode.
  • Passenger cancellations don't affect your place in line. If your passenger cancels on you, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue.
  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.
  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers from either of the 2 designated loading/unloading zones.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up. Instead, head to the staging lot and wait there.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers at either of the 2 designated loading/unloading zones.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal or accept additional ride requests after drop-off.

Back to airport list
Back to top

Raleigh-Durham International Airport (RDU)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area. Only drivers within the designated staging area are added to the queue. To get there, make a left from Airport Blvd and enter on Dept Dr and enter the code LYFT (5938) to open the gate (Open in Google Maps).
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.
  • If the staging area is full, you must leave the airport. You may not wait for requests anywhere else on airport property or use any other parking lots while in driver mode.
  • Passenger cancellations don't affect your place in line. If your passenger cancels on you, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue.
  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.
  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Additional staging area rules:

  • Keep your Lyft emblem affixed to the lower right hand side of your windshield (not resting on the dashboard).
  • Do not tailgate the vehicle in front of you when entering and exiting the staging area.
  • Let the gate arm come down between you and the vehicle in front of you — each driver should enter the code on the gate themselves when entering the staging area.
    • Any driver who damages the gate will be responsible for the cost of repair/replacement.
  • When entering the staging area stay to the right side of the red line painted on the ground and park in designated spaces.
  • Do not speed in the staging area. The speed limit in the terminal and staging areas is 20 mph.
  • Be respectful and courteous to others drivers and to RDU Personnel.
  • Always display your Lyft emblem when giving rides or waiting for requests on airport proerty.
  • Do not leave your vehicle unattended.
  • Do not clean or perform any maintenance work on your vehicle in while in the staging area.
  • Do not throw trash on the ground or on the roadways — use the trash cans and ashtrays that have been provided.
  • You must vacate the staging area no later than ½ hour after the last flight arrives every night. Violators will be ticketed.

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers from the Commercial Curb, Prearranged Ride Zones (Zone #1 at Terminal 1, Zone #17 at Terminal 2) on the ticketing and baggage claim level.
    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to an approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location and are on the correct level of the airport.
  • If your passenger is delayed do not stage curbside. Please circle back and always observe the requests of airport management.
  • Do not hand out referral cards while on airport property.
  • Pre-dispatch: While waiting for requests, you may receive an SMS and an in-app note directing you to head toward the terminal. While en route, you should receive a ride request. If you do not, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue. More information on pre-dispatch can be found here.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers at Departures, at your passenger's carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal after drop-off. If you'd like to wait for requests, head to the staging area.

Back to airport list
Back to top

Wilmington International Airport (ILM)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area. Only drivers within the designated staging area (pictured above) are added to the queue.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Pickups:

    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to an approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location and are on the correct level of the airport.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up. Instead, head to the staging lot and wait there.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers at Departures at the passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport after drop-off. You must leave airport property immediately after dropping off your passenger.

Back to airport list
Back to top

All Other Permitted Airports

articles.name: Oklahoma airport information for drivers
articles.title: Oklahoma airport information for drivers
articles.body:
To ensure a smooth airport experience for you and your passengers, make sure to familiarize yourself with the rules below. Tap each link to jump to detailed instructions on each section:

  • Rules for all airports
  • Permitted Airports

The following information applies to all airports:

Airport officials will issue administrative citations to drivers who do not follow the rules. You are responsible for paying any tickets you receive for violating airport rules and regulations.

Lyft emblem
  • Keep your Lyft emblem displayed in your lower right hand (passenger side) of your front windshield at all times while giving Lyft rides.
  • If you are giving a non-Lyft ride at the airport, make sure to remove your emblem before entering airport property.
  • If you’ve just been approved to drive, you should receive your Lyft emblem shortly. If you didn't get one or need a new one, place an order in your Dashboard. While waiting for it to arrive, you may print a temporary emblem.

Conduct at the airport
  • Do not stop or pull over in crosswalks.
  • Do not park in red zones or taxi/shuttle areas unless otherwise specified in the rules above.
  • Always follow instructions given by airport personnel.
  • If you run into any trouble, like a regulatory citation, reach out to our Support team. We're here to help 24/7.
Waybill
  • Airport authorities may ask you for a waybill, which shows your latest ride. Click here to learn how to access your waybill.

Back to top

Permitted Airports

Drivers on the Lyft platform are responsible for knowing and following all airport regulations in order to avoid receiving administrative citations from the airport. Lyft is available at the following airports in Oklahoma:

  • Lawton-Fort Sill Regional Airport | LAW
  • Oklahoma City Will Rogers World Airport | OKC
  • Stillwater Regional Airport | SWO
  • Tulsa International Airport | TUL

Waiting for requests:

  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.
  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers from the departures level, west of the terminal before the covered area of the terminal begins. Please only pick up passengers under the covered area during inclement weather.
    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to an approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location and are on the correct level of the airport.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers curbside at the terminal entrance, at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal after drop-off.

Back to top

Tulsa International Airport (TUL)

Waiting for requests:

  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.

Pickups:

  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers curbside at the terminal entrance, at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal after drop-off.

All Other Permitted Airports

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers on the upper level of the main terminal, past the last set of doors near the bus shelter.
    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to the approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location and are on the correct level of the airport.
  • Do not pick up passengers from the terminal entrance.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up. Instead, head to short term parking and wait there.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers at Departures, at the passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal or accept additional ride requests after drop-off. Instead, proceed to short term parking.

Back to airport list
Back to top

Philadelphia International Airport (PHL)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area. Only drivers within the designated staging area (1 International Plaza Drive off of State Highway 291) are added to the queue. Drivers cannot receive requests in the Cell Phone Lot.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.
  • If the staging area is full, you must leave the airport. You may not wait for requests anywhere else on airport property or use any other parking lots while in driver mode.
  • Passenger cancellations don't affect your place in line. If your passenger cancels on you, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue.
  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.
  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers from Arrivals.
    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to the approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location and are on the correct level of the airport.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed. Instead, head to the staging area and wait there.
  • Pre-dispatch: While waiting for requests, you may receive an SMS and an in-app note directing you to head toward the terminal. While en route, you should receive a ride request. If you do not, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue. More information on pre-dispatch can be found here.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers at Departures at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal or accept additional ride requests after drop-off. If you want to accept additional ride requests, proceed to the staging area.
  • As soon as you've dropped off your passenger, press 'Tap to drop off' in your app and exit airport property. Wait to rate your passenger until you've left the airport.

Back to airport list
Back to top

Pittsburgh International Airport (PIT)

Pittsburgh International Airport (PIT) Rules Acknowledgement:

  • Drivers on the Lyft platform are responsible for knowing the Pittsburgh International Airport (PIT) rules and regulations; and training materials prior to operating there. To certify that you understand the requirements for operating at the airport, access and complete your acknowledgement within the Lyft app

To Staging Lot: Staging Lot to Pickups: To Drop-offs:

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area. Only drivers within the staging area (Extended Lot, pictured above) are added to the queue.
    • To enter the lot, (while traveling southbound on Airport Blvd), veer left near the Sunoco gas station, following the "Return to terminal" signs.
    • Stay left and drive through the "DO NOT ENTER", "EMERGENCY AND AUTHORIZED VEHICLES ONLY" and "Uber/Lyft Staging" signs down the sloped area to the designated parking spaces on the right.
    • See maps above for more detail.
    • Exit the lot through Gate 46.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.

  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups:

  • Pick up arriving passengers at the commercial curb (purple curb), at the designated TNC spaces between doors 2 and 4 — make sure to pull up to the furthest available space
    • Drivers are not permitted to pick up in the travel lane nor in any other spot at the commercial curb outside of the designated area. If there are no spots available, drivers are advised to loop around the airport.
    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to the approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location and are on the correct level of the airport.
  • Do not advertise on your vehicle while operating on airport property.
  • Do not pick up passengers from the public curb or the travel lane.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up. Instead, wait in the Cell Phone Lot (pictured above) if your passenger is delayed. If the Cell Phone Lot is full, you will need to leave airport property.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers at Departures at the passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal or accept additional ride requests after drop-off. Instead, proceed to the Cell Phone Lot.

  • In addition to displaying your emblem on the front windshield, PIT airport also requires that you display a second emblem on the back windshield as well.

articles.name: Rhode Island airport information for drivers
articles.title: Rhode Island airport information for drivers
articles.body:
To ensure a smooth airport experience for you and your passengers, make sure to familiarize yourself with the rules below. Tap each link to jump to detailed instructions on each section:

  • Rules for all airports
  • Permitted Airports

The following information applies to all airports:

Airport officials will issue administrative citations to drivers who do not follow the rules. You are responsible for paying any tickets you receive for violating airport rules and regulations.

Lyft emblem
  • Keep your Lyft emblem displayed in your lower right hand (passenger side) of your front windshield at all times while giving Lyft rides.
  • If you are giving a non-Lyft ride at the airport, make sure to remove your emblem before entering airport property.
  • If you’ve just been approved to drive, you should receive your Lyft emblem shortly. If you didn't get one or need a new one, place an order in your Dashboard. While waiting for it to arrive, you may print a temporary emblem.

Conduct at the airport
  • Do not stop or pull over in crosswalks.
  • Do not park in red zones or taxi/shuttle areas unless otherwise specified in the rules above.
  • Always follow instructions given by airport personnel.
  • If you run into any trouble, like a regulatory citation, reach out to our Support team. We're here to help 24/7.
Waybill
  • Airport authorities may ask you for a waybill, which shows your latest ride. Click here to learn how to access your waybill.

Back to top

Permitted Airports

Drivers on the Lyft platform are responsible for knowing and following all airport regulations in order to avoid receiving administrative citations from the airport. Lyft is available at the following aiport in Rhode Island:

T.F. Green International Airport - Providence (PVD)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated assignment area pictured above. Only drivers within the designated assignment area are added to the queue.
  • Loitering is strictly prohibited in the staging area. Drivers should remain in their vehicles while waiting for requests. Violations could result in citations and/or bans.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the assignment area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the assignment area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the assignment area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.
  • Passenger cancellations don't affect your place in line. If your passenger cancels on you, head back to the assignment area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue.
  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.
  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups

  • Pick up passengers in the commercial lane.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs

  • Drop off passengers curbside at the terminal entrance, at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal or accept additional ride requests after drop-off.

Back to top

  • Knoxville McGhee Tyson Airport | TYS
  • Memphis International Airport | MEM
  • Nashville International Airport | BNA
Chattanooga Metropolitan Airport (CHA)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area pictured above located here. Only drivers within the designated staging area are added to the queue.
  • The staging area is a strictly no-smoking zone. The staging area is located close to airplane fuel reserves and therefore is a potential fire hazard for open flames and lit cigarettes.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.
  • If the staging area is full, you must leave the airport. You may not wait for requests anywhere else on airport property or use any other parking lots while in driver mode.
  • Passenger cancellations don't affect your place in line. If your passenger cancels on you, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue.
  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.
  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers from Arrivals, at the location of your passenger's pin in the app.
    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to an approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location and are on the correct level of the airport.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up. Instead, head to the staging area or ask the passenger to cancel and request another ride when they are ready.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers curbside at the terminal entrance, at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal after drop-off.

Back to airport list
Back to top

Knoxville McGhee Tyson Airport (TYS)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area pictured above. Only drivers within the designated staging area are added to the queue.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.

Pickups:

Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers curbside at the terminal entrance, at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal after drop-off.

Back to airport list
Back to top

Memphis International Airport (MEM)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait for requests in the Cell Phone Lot (Open in Google Maps). You must park in one of the 10 available spaces designated for Lyft. If there are no available spaces, you must leave airport property.

Pickups:

  • Beginning 3/1/2018, Lyft will be piloting "Rematch" at MEM. This feature enables you to be matched with additional passenger(s) shortly before or after completing a drop-off. This means you can receive a pickup request up to 2 minutes after dropping off a passenger without returning to the staging area.
  • Starting on 3/1/2018, pick up passengers from departures on the upper level at the 3 designated areas by each terminal's crosswalk. When you approach the upper level, veer to the left and pick up your passenger from the outer left lane (Commercial Vehicle Lane).
    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to the approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location and are on the correct level of the airport.
  • Wait in the Cell Phone Lot if your passenger is delayed when picking up. You must park in one of the 10 available spaces designated for Lyft. If there are no available spaces, you must leave airport property.
  • Do not pick up passengers at the curbside terminal entrance.
  • Pre-dispatch: While waiting for requests, you may receive an SMS and an in-app note directing you to head toward the terminal. While en route, you should receive a ride request. If you do not, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue. More information on pre-dispatch can be found here.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers at Departures on the upper level at your passenger’s carrier of choice. Be sure to unload passengers in the outer lane (Commercial Vehicle Lane) unless otherwise specified by the passenger or if they require special assistance.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal after drop-off. If you'd like to wait for additional requests, head to the Cell Phone Lot.

Back to airport list
Back to top

Nashville International Airport (BNA)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area. Only drivers within the designated staging area (pictured above) are added to the queue.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.
  • If the staging area is full, you must leave the airport. You may not wait for requests anywhere else on airport property or use any other parking lots while in driver mode.
  • Passenger cancellations don't affect your place in line. If your passenger cancels on you, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue.
  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.
  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups:

  • Beginning 12/20/2018, pickups take place inside the new Ground Transportation Center in the far right lane. To access this building, take the first right onto the ramp after exiting the Rideshare staging lot. There will be signs directing you towards the appropriate area.
    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to the approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location and are on the correct level of the airport.
  • If your passenger needs longer than 20 minutes, use the designated staging area (pictured above). If there are no available parking spaces, you will need to leave airport property.
  • Do not pick up passengers on Level 2.
  • Pre-dispatch: While waiting for requests, you may receive an SMS and an in-app note directing you to head toward the terminal. While en route, you should receive a ride request. If you do not, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue. More information on pre-dispatch can be found here.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers on the Departures (Level 3) at the passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not drop off passengers on Level 2.

Back to airport list
Back to top

All Other Permitted Airports

The rules below for pickups and drop-offs apply to the following airports:

  • Blountville Tri-Cities (TRI)
  • Clarksville-Montgomery (CKV)

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers from Arrivals, at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers curbside at the terminal entrance, at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal or accept additional ride requests after drop-off.

Back to top

articles.name: Texas airport information for drivers
articles.title: Texas airport information for drivers
articles.body:
To ensure a smooth airport experience for you and your passengers, make sure to familiarize yourself with the rules below. Tap each link to jump to detailed instructions on each section:

  • Rules for all airports
  • Permitted Airports
  • Prohibited Airports

The following information applies to all airports:

Airport officials will issue administrative citations to drivers who do not follow the rules. You are responsible for paying any tickets you receive for violating airport rules and regulations.

Lyft emblem
  • Keep your Lyft emblem displayed in your lower right hand (passenger side) of your front windshield at all times while giving Lyft rides.
  • If you are giving a non-Lyft ride at the airport, make sure to remove your emblem before entering airport property.
  • If you’ve just been approved to drive, you should receive your Lyft emblem shortly. If you didn't get one or need a new one, place an order in your Dashboard. While waiting for it to arrive, you may print a temporary emblem.

Conduct at the airport
  • Do not stop or pull over in crosswalks.
  • Do not park in red zones or taxi/shuttle areas unless otherwise specified in the rules above.
  • Always follow instructions given by airport personnel.
  • If you run into any trouble, like a regulatory citation, reach out to our Support team. We're here to help 24/7.
Waybill
  • Airport authorities may ask you for a waybill, which shows your latest ride. Click here to learn how to access your waybill.

Back to top

Permitted Airports

Drivers on the Lyft platform are responsible for knowing and following all airport regulations in order to avoid receiving administrative citations from the airport. Lyft is available at the following airports in Texas:

  • Austin-Bergstrom International Airport | AUS
    • South Terminal
  • Beaumont Jack Brooks Regional Airport | BPT

  • San Antonio International Airport | SAT
  • San Angelo Regional Airport | SJT
  • San Antonio: Stinson Municipal Airport | SSF

  • Valley International Airport | HRL
  • Wichita Falls Municipal Airport | SPS

Austin-Bergstrom International Airport (AUS)

    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to an approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location.

  • Rematch is a feature that enables you to be matched with additional passenger(s) shortly before or after completing a drop-off. This means you can receive a ride request for up to 2 minutes after dropping off a passenger without returning to the staging lot.

    • Once drivers are in the TNC Pickup Area, continue to pull vehicles forward towards Pickup Area #5.
    • Drivers will be allowed up to 1 minute to wait/load passengers before being asked to circle the terminal. Failure to circle after 1 minute or when directed can result in citations.
    • Pickups must be made in the Lower Level Transportation Network Area (TNC Pickup Area) only. Pickups made in an unauthorized area can result in citations.
    • No pickups will be allowed in Lane #1 (far left lane) which is only designated as a thru-lane. Stopping or blocking this lane can result in a citation.
    • Vehicles must occupy only one lane and must move forward when space is available.

El Paso International Airport (ELP)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area pictured above. Only drivers within the designated staging area (pictured above, off Piper Ct) are added to the queue.

Houston: George Bush Intercontinental Airport (IAH)

Pickups:

Airport Permit

  • An airport permit is required to give rides at IAH and HOU airports.
  • Beginning July 1, 2019, the location and process for obtaining a HAS sticker to operate a vehicle at both IAH and HOU airports will change.
  • The new address is: 6135 Will Clayton Parkway, Humble, TX 77338
    • Hours of Operation: Mon - Thu: 8-12pm, 1pm-4pm | Fri: 8am-12pm
  • Drivers will need the following to complete their application (all are required to be current with dates clearly visible):
    • Current copy of your driver’s license
    • Current vehicle liability insurance
    • Current vehicle registration.
  • Follow this process to obtain a HAS sticker for your vehicle:
    1. Visit https://www.fly2houston.com/biz/resources/commercial-vehicle-permits/ to submit a free commercial vehicle application online. Permits can only be applied for online
    2. Once the application is approved, you will be sent a link to schedule an appointment to pick up your permit.
    3. The new permitting office is drive-through only, by appointment only. There will be no walk-ins

Back to airport list
Back to top

Houston: William P. Hobby Airport (HOU)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area. Only drivers within the designated staging area (7748 Airport Blvd, Houston, TX 77061) are added to the queue.
  • Once routed onto airport property, follow black and white airport signs to access the TNC Staging Lot via S Rent Car Rd.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.
  • If the staging area is full, you must leave the airport. You may not wait for requests anywhere else on airport property or use any other parking lots while in driver mode.
  • Passenger cancellations don't affect your place in line. If your passenger cancels on you, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue.
  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.
  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers from the TNC pickup zone at the Terminal (pictured above) — look for the TNC pickup signs.
    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to an approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location and are on the correct level of the airport.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up.
  • Pre-dispatch: While waiting for requests, you may receive an SMS and an in-app note directing you to head toward the terminal. While en route, you should receive a ride request. If you do not, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue. More information on pre-dispatch can be found here.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers at Departures, at your passenger's carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal after drop-off.

Airport Permit

  • An airport permit is required to give rides at IAH and HOU airports.
  • Beginning July 1, 2019, the location and process for obtaining a HAS sticker to operate a vehicle at both IAH and HOU airports will change.
  • The new address is: 6135 Will Clayton Parkway, Humble, TX 77338
    • Hours of Operation: Mon - Thu: 8-12pm, 1pm-4pm | Fri: 8am-12pm
  • Drivers will need the following to complete their application (all are required to be current with dates clearly visible):
    • Current copy of your driver’s license
    • Current vehicle liability insurance
    • Current vehicle registration.
  • Follow this process to obtain a HAS sticker for your vehicle:
    1. Visit https://www.fly2houston.com/biz/resources/commercial-vehicle-permits/ to submit a free commercial vehicle application online. Permits can only be applied for online
    2. Once the application is approved, you will be sent a link to schedule an appointment to pick up your permit.
    3. The new permitting office is drive-through only, by appointment only. There will be no walk-ins

Back to airport list
Back to top

Lubbock Preston Smith International Airport (LBB)

  • Wait in the designated staging area pictured above. Only drivers within the designated staging area are added to the queue.
  • Pull a ticket upon entering. When entering the staging area, pull one ticket per vehicle from the ticket spitter. The ticket and electronic waybill will be presented to the curbside attendant or Airport Police prior to pickup.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.

Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers curbside at the terminal entrance, at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal for ride requests after drop-off. If you'd like to wait for requests, head to the staging area.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal after drop-off.

Back to airport list
Back to top

San Antonio International Airport (SAT)

  • Wait in the designated staging area. Only drivers within the designated area (pictured above) are added to the queue.

  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.

Pickups:

  • Do not pick up passengers at the upper or lower level curbside terminal entrances.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up.

Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Do not wait at the airport terminal after drop-off.

  • San Angelo Regional Airport | SJT
  • San Antonio: Stinson Municipal Airport | SSF
  • Tyler Pounds Regional Airport | TYR

articles.name: Utah airport information for drivers
articles.title: Utah airport information for drivers
articles.body:
To ensure a smooth airport experience for you and your passengers, make sure to familiarize yourself with the rules below. Tap each link to jump to detailed instructions on each section:

  • Rules for all airports
  • Permitted Airports

The following information applies to all airports:

Airport officials will issue administrative citations to drivers who do not follow the rules. You are responsible for paying any tickets you receive for violating airport rules and regulations.

Lyft emblem
  • Keep your Lyft emblem displayed in your lower right hand (passenger side) of your front windshield at all times while giving Lyft rides.
  • If you are giving a non-Lyft ride at the airport, make sure to remove your emblem before entering airport property.
  • If you’ve just been approved to drive, you should receive your Lyft emblem shortly. If you didn't get one or need a new one, place an order in your Dashboard. While waiting for it to arrive, you may print a temporary emblem.

Conduct at the airport
  • Do not stop or pull over in crosswalks.
  • Do not park in red zones or taxi/shuttle areas unless otherwise specified in the rules above.
  • Always follow instructions given by airport personnel.
  • If you run into any trouble, like a regulatory citation, reach out to our Support team. We're here to help 24/7.
Waybill
  • Airport authorities may ask you for a waybill, which shows your latest ride. Click here to learn how to access your waybill.

Back to top

Permitted Airports

Drivers on the Lyft platform are responsible for knowing and following all airport regulations in order to avoid receiving administrative citations from the airport. Lyft is available at the following airports in Utah:

  • Logan-Cache Airport | LGU
  • Provo Municipal Airport | PVU
  • Salt Lake City International Airport | SLC
  • St. George Regional Airport | SGU
Salt Lake City International Airport (SLC)

Waiting for requests:

  • Wait in the designated staging area pictured above. Only drivers within the designated staging area (pictured below) are added to the queue.
  • The queue is first in-first out. The driver who has been waiting within the staging area in driver mode the longest gets the next request. Your physical location within the staging area does not affect your spot in the queue, but if you exit the staging area or log out of driver mode, you will lose your spot.
  • If the staging area is full, you must leave the airport. You may not wait for requests anywhere else on airport property or use any other parking lots while in driver mode.
  • Passenger cancellations don't affect your place in line. If your passenger cancels on you, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue.
  • Driver cancellations and missed requests do affect your place in line. If you are the one to cancel a request, or if you miss a request, you're placed at the back of the queue.
  • You can view your place in line in the app. Learn how to view your position in the queue here.

Pickups:

  • Beginning 9/15/2020, pick up passengers in front of the new terminal building in the middle lane (lower level) at the designated rideshare pickup area as pictured above.
    • The Lyft app moves the passenger's pin to an approved pickup area. If you're having trouble finding each other, make sure you have both gone to the pin's location and are on the correct level of the airport.
  • Do not pick up passengers at the curbside terminal entrance.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed. Instead, proceed to the staging area.
  • Pre-dispatch: While waiting for requests, you may receive an SMS and an in-app note directing you to head toward the terminal. While en route, you should receive a ride request. If you do not, head back to the staging area. As long as you're back within 15 minutes, you'll be placed at the front of the queue. More information on pre-dispatch can be found here.
  • Short ride bump: If you receive a request for a short ride from the airport after waiting in the queue, you may qualify for a higher queue position after you drop off your passenger. You'll receive an SMS after dropping off to let you know you have the option to return to the staging area for a preferred spot in the queue. Please note, if you give a ride before returning to the staging area, you may still qualify for a preferred spot in line.

Drop-offs:

  • Beginning 9/15/2020, drop off passengers in front of the new terminal building in the middle lane (lower level) at the designated rideshare drop-off area as pictured above.
  • Do not wait at the airport after drop-off. If you'd like to wait for additional request, head to the staging area.

Back to airport list
Back to top

St. George Regional Airport (SGU)

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers curbside at the north end of the terminal (pictured above).
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up. If your passenger needs more time, kindly ask them to cancel the ride and re-request when they are ready to go.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers curbside at the north end of the terminal (pictured above).
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal or accept additional ride requests after drop-off.

Back to airport list
Back to top

All Other Permitted Airports

The rules below for pickups and drop-offs apply to the following airports:

  • Logan-Cache Airport | LGU
  • Provo Municipal Airport | PVU

Pickups:

  • Pick up passengers from Arrivals, at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait or circle back at the airport if the passenger is delayed when picking up.

Drop-offs:

  • Drop off passengers curbside at the terminal entrance, at your passenger’s carrier of choice.
  • Do not wait at the airport terminal or accept additional ride requests after drop-off.

Back to top
